item.title: Void Linux
item.description: Introduction to Void Linux Void Linux is a lightweight, independent, rolling release operating system that is known for its simplicity and speed. It is a distribution that is built from scratch, without using any pre-existing codebase, which makes it unique in the world of Linux distributions. What sets Void Linux apart from other distributions? One of the main differences between Void Linux and other Linux distributions is its package management system.

item.title: Arch Install Using Archinstaller
item.description: How to Install Arch Linux Using Archinstaller Arch Linux is a popular, lightweight and flexible Linux distribution that is known for its simplicity and customization. It is suitable for users who want to have full control over their system and want to build it from scratch. Installing Arch Linux can be a daunting task for beginners, especially if you are not familiar with the command line. But don’t worry, there is a tool called Archinstaller that makes the process much easier and faster.

item.title: Arch Install (Minimal)
item.description: How to Install ArchLinux ArchLinux is a Linux-based operating system that uses the KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid) principle. This makes ArchLinux easy to use for users who want to customize their operating system according to their needs. Here are the steps for installing ArchLinux: Preparation Download the ArchLinux ISO from its site. Create a bootable USB or CD/DVD using the ISO. Make sure your computer is connected to the internet.

item.title: Ubuntu Install
item.description: How to Install Ubuntu As one of the popular open-source operating systems, Ubuntu is a good choice for users who want to try a new operating system. Here are the steps to install Ubuntu on your computer. Preparation Download the Ubuntu installation file from the official website Download Ubuntu Desktop | Download | Ubuntu. Choose the version that suits your needs. Create a bootable USB or DVD. You can use applications like Rufus or Etcher to create a bootable USB.
